parsedComplaintsResult.impact: A defective head gasket can cause oil leaks onto the engine, leading to a potential risk of fire, and poor engine oil consumption, which can result in engine damage and decreased performance.
A faulty thermostat can cause coolant leaks, leading to engine overheating, damage, and potential failure.
A failed serpentine belt can cause engine accessories to malfunction, leading to decreased performance, engine damage, and potential breakdowns.
The unavailability of replacement parts can lead to prolonged vehicle downtime, increased repair costs, and decreased vehicle safety.

The failure of the engine accessory bracket can cause the power steering pump, air compressor, air pump, and water pump to become dislodged, leading to belt failure, loss of power steering, and engine overheating, which can result in accidents or engine damage.
symptoms: Cracking or breaking of the bracket
sheering off of the mounting bolt

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Defective idler arms can cause the serpentine belt to malfunction, leading to engine overheating, loss of power steering, and engine failure, which can result in accidents or engine damage.
Faulty door handles can cause inconvenience and difficulty in entering or exiting the vehicle, potentially leading to accidents or injuries.
symptoms: Door handles break or become loose
making it difficult to open or close the doors.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Peeling paint can lead to rust and corrosion, compromising the structural integrity of the vehicle and potentially causing safety issues.
symptoms: Paint peels off the roof and hood of the vehicle
exposing the underlying metal to the elements.
